page.title: 11WITHINGTON POST OFFICE
page.content: {Withington Post Office}is situated on a lane near Norman's cash and carry. The Post Office has been there since 1976 but the shop since 1915. Mr. Thursfield has owned the shop for 3 years and employs 4 paperboys and ,on Sundays, an assistant. The shop is full of magazines, sweets and 'papers ranging from "The Daily Telegraph" to "The Withington news." The shop is open from 7.30 until 5.30 ,closing for lunch from 1.30 until 2.30. Thursday is the busiest day, as "The Hereford Times" is out, and pensions are collected. Newspapers are delivered within a 2 mile radius of the Post Office. The owner, who lives above the shop with his wife and 2 sons, says that he prefers working in a rural area such as this.
